key_points: Tom Brady will play in his record 10th Super Bowl against the Kansas City Chiefs on Feb. 7, 2021.
This will be Brady's first Super Bowl with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, having previously played with the New England Patriots.
Brady holds a 6-3 record in Super Bowl appearances.
He also holds the record for the most Super Bowl rings with six.
Brady holds multiple Super Bowl records, including most MVPs (4), most wins (6), and most total yards thrown (2,838).
His first Super Bowl win was in 2002 with the Patriots defeating the St. Louis Rams.
Brady's only two Super Bowl losses came against the New York Giants.
The article recaps Brady's performance and significance in each of his previous nine Super Bowl appearances.
Brady's upcoming Super Bowl LV appearance will be against Patrick Mahomes, whom he previously beat in the 2019 AFC title game.
The Super Bowl LV will have a reduced crowd due to COVID-19 protocols.
